text: We do not support localization at the moment.
We provide `timezone` in the `context` prop along with portalId. You'll have to do the conversion yourself though.
cc: <@U05KNCMAE7N> / <@U03FJQPSC0Y>
Is anyone having issues uploading to projects right now?

Noticed that an update to the docs just got pushed for the nodejs version saying that the required version is 16 or higher. The platform version 2023.2 says Node 18 or higher is required though.

<https://arc.net/l/quote/pmslodsx>
<https://arc.net/l/quote/rljczxkm>
<@U0488SNUMUJ> *, i was just typing myself, same issue here and this is a project that uploaded fine on Tuesday. I reverted all changes and get the same error
Tried deleting all package files, reinstalling npm and HubSpot packages but still no luck
Sorry I think we're talking about 2 separate things
Apologies, meant to tag the person above. Must of swapped names in my mind
no problem at all
I'm also looking into that issue as well
Hi Lew, can you share what command you're running to upload the project?
`hs project upload`
Hi Christian, can you share what command you're using to upload the project? And if you ran `npm install` before uploading?
Thanks. Do you recall if you ran `npm install` first? Also if you have your code available to share that would be helpful as well, so I could try to reproduce it.

<@UNHBK8QNM>, currently I am using the same command I have been previously
```hs project upload --account=account_name```
I did also delete all package lock files and run npm install & npm i @HubSpot/ui-extensions@latest -> after running those I still received the same error.
I also removed all usage of context from the file being flagged and attempted to reupload but received the same missing context error as well
fwiw the file uploaded fine in the same state it is currently in earlier this week without this error
No, but just tried to install it first and still received the error. We've tested with one of sample projects and still received the error. Locally everything is working.
<@U056ZR8LVJQ>
Seems to be working now :+1:
Thanks Lew, this appears to be related to a recent change that was made on our end. we're undoing the change now.
I saw in the other thread that it may be working and can confirm it works now for me as well
Thanks, Christian. It appears to be related to a recent change that was made on our end. A fix is being put in now.
Hey Christian, should be all back to normal. Can you give it a test and let me know if you run any more issues?
Just circling back here to confirm that we've fixed things on our end, so if you run into any similar issues please let us know!
<@UNHBK8QNM>, sorry for the delay. Just tested and all is well on my end still. Thanks again
Also this page just got updated with nodejs version 16: <https://arc.net/l/quote/izrsjqjl>
Definitely, I'll let you know if it happens again
